Functions
CreateSurfaceRevolution
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateSurfaceRevolution(
std::
vector<Vector3> 
&
pts,
uint32_t 
npts,
uint32_t 
subdivisions,
float 
maxAngle
)

Generates a solid by revolving the specified polygon around the Y axis. All points are assumed to be relative to the world coordinate origin (thus the point specifies the point's normal vector).

Parameters
pts
std::vector<Vector3>&

List of points (should be increasing Y value)

npts
uint32_t

Number of points in 'pts'

subdivisions
uint32_t

Number of subdivisions to generate around the Y axis

maxAngle
float

Maximum number of degrees to rotate around Y axis

Returns

Return newly generated mesh

CreateSphere
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateSphere(
uint32_t 
subdivisions
)

Creates a mesh in the shape of a sphere.

Parameters
subdivisions
uint32_t

Number of divisions along azimuth and elevation

Returns

Returns the created mesh

CreateTetrahedron
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateTetrahedron()

Creates a mesh in the shape of a tetrahedron

Returns

Returns the created mesh

CreateWarpedGrid
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateWarpedGrid(
uint32_t 
width,
uint32_t 
height,
float2 
*
pPositions
)

Generates a grid mesh of size -1..+1,-1..+1 with texture coordinates spanning the entire mesh from 0..1. The grid points are specified by the client allowing for the grid to have a warped shape.

Parameters
width
uint32_t

number of vertices in X direction

height
uint32_t

number of vertices in Y direction

pPositions
float2*

list of coordinates for each grid location

Returns

Returns the created mesh

CreateGrid
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateGrid(
uint32_t 
width,
uint32_t 
height,
float2* 
uvs
)

Generates a grid mesh of size -1..+1,-1..+1 with texture coordinates spanning the entire mesh from 0..1. The grid UVs are specified by the client.

Parameters
width
uint32_t

number of vertices in X direction

height
uint32_t

number of vertices in Y direction

uvs
float2*

list of UVs for each grid location

Returns

Returns the created mesh

CreateGrid

height

height

Returns

CreateGrid
CRefObj<IMesh> CreateGrid(
uint32_t 
subdivisions
)

Generates a grid mesh of size -1..+1,-1..+1 with texture coordinates spanning the entire mesh from 0..1

Parameters
subdivisions
uint32_t

Number of times to subdivide the grid

Returns

Returns the created mesh
